Description: Papyrus written with black ink, with demotic text: recto (3 cols.) and verso (2 ll.). Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Accounts connected with a temple, dealing with flour, hay, salt &c. Date. year 22, Thoth 11 of an unnamed King".
Curator's comments: Publ. Revillout, Melanges 1895 p.51. C.A.R. Andrews, 'Some Temple Accounts', in C. Eyre, A. Leahy and L. Montagno Leahy, 'The Unbroken Reed: Studies in the Culture and Heritage of Ancient Egypt in Honour of A.F. Shore' (EES OP, London, 1994), pp. 25-33.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (50057) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/50057)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: frayed Black ink Backed: brown paper Unsupported locally Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Sandwich: board Binding: leather Window verso Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: good
